facts.title: MMR Vaccine is Highly Effective
facts.content: The MMR vaccine is about 97% effective at preventing measles and 88% effective at preventing mumps.

children.title: Measles Efficacy Study
children.content: A 2019 meta-analysis of 50 studies confirmed the high efficacy of two doses of the MMR vaccine against measles.

children.title: Mumps Efficacy Study
children.content: Effectiveness against mumps is documented to be slightly lower than measles but still provides significant community protection.

children.title: Mumps Outbreak Data
children.content: Data from recent outbreaks show that vaccinated individuals have a significantly lower risk of complications.

facts.title: Vaccines Do Not Cause Autism
facts.content: Numerous large-scale studies have found no link between any vaccine and the likelihood of developing autism.
